description: On March 15, the Yemeni Ministry of Health approved the allocation of an “emergency budget” of one billion Yemeni riyals ($4 million) to support the health sector and enable it to implement the precautionary and preventative measures to protect the country from the spread of the coronavirus.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 5, health Minister Dr. Nasser Ba’oum said the government, with support from the King Salman Relief and Humanitarian Action Center, has allocated 580 million Yemeni riyals (nearly $900,000*) to authorities in all non-Houthi-controlled governorates and 500 million rials (about $770,000) to the Aden branch of the Central Bank of Yemen, to be distributed to health facilities.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: As of April 16, 2020, 27 health isolation centers were opened in nine governorates, as part of the precautionary measures to prevent the emerging coronavirus (Covid-19), including the governorates of Al-Mahra, Hadramout, Abyan, Lahj, Marib, Taiz, Shabwa, Al-Dhalea., and Aden.

description: As of October 31, 2020, due to the complex conflict dynamics and migrant protection concerns across the country, IOM and partners continue to advocate against discriminatory policies and human rights abuses against migrants. This includes detention and forced transfers, the establishment of quarantine centres to hold migrants (de facto detention centres that do not follow COVID-19 standard protocols), and the lack of inclusive solutions in the management of the COVID-19 crisis throughout the country. IOM also keeps advocating against quarantine centres for migrants and refugees only, as a measure to avail discriminatory policies of arrest, encampment, or detention.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Asylum/refugee seekers,Other population not specifed above
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: To help protect prisons from an outbreak of the virus, the Yemeni local authorities in Shabwa governorate released 43 prisoners on March 28 after a review of their individual cases by a committee formed by Shabwa governor Mohammed Saleh Bin Adyo in coordination with the governorate’s chief prosecutor.

description: On March 29, the prosecutor’s office in the province of Al-Mahra in Yemen released 49 prisoners who had served two thirds of their sentences to ease the overcrowding of prisons. The authorities in Al-Mahra say they have paid 17 million Yemeni riyals, nearly $31 thousand in bonds to secure the release of prisoners in those cases requiring a financial surety that the defendants will reappear if summoned.
